titleStmt.title: By the King. A declaration. James R. Whereas several officers of our army did take and retain in their service several servants belonging to French officers, without the consent and approbation of their masters: ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

titleStmt.title: By the King. A declaration. James R. Whereas several officers of our army did take and retain in their service several servants belonging to French officers, without the consent and approbation of their masters: ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook the assignee of Benjamin Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin-Castle the 24th day of January 1689."
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Servants of French officers not to be taken into service. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
